_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary for Pawnee Coutny Cooperative- Larned



For further information regarding this plan, please contact:

Pawnee County Cooperative

P.O. Box 50

Larned, Kansas 67550

620/285-2161



1.  The Facility Policy

The members and employees of Pawnee County Cooperative are committed to the prevention of accidental release of anhydrous ammonia.  If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the local fire department and other mitigate any release and minimize the impact of the release to people and the enivronment.



2.  Facility Information

-This facility uses the most current safety measures where added at that time.

-The primary activity at this facility is the storage of fertilizer for sale to farmers.

-Anyhdrous Ammonia is received, stored, and distributed for direct application.

-The ammonia is delivered in by truck.



3.  The Accidental Release Prevention Program

-This facility has implemented to the provisions of Safety Requirements for the Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia K-61-1, published by the American National Standards Institute, Inc. and the standards of the US Occupational Safety and Health Adminstration, 29 CFR 1910-111, Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia.



4.  The Five-Year Accident History

-There has been no accidental release of anhydous ammonia that have cuased any deaths, injuries or caused significant property damage at the facilty, or any offsite consequences of a release.



5.  The Emergency Response Program

-The facility has:

-A written emergency action plan in accordance 29 CFR 1910-38 (OSHA).

-Provided state and local authorities the emergency planning and community right-to-know information as required under SARA Title III (EPCRA).

-A written emergency response program, in accordance 29 CFR 1910-120 (OSHA) including pre-emergency planning and employee training.



6.  Planning Changes to Improve Safety 

-Safety improvement is an on-going process at this facility.  Per
iodic inspections are performed to assess the maintenance of safe conditions.  There are no  additional specific anhydrous ammonia safety recommendations for implementation at this time.
